Assign a special chunk name to identify these very large chunks more easily.

*
     * @name setLanguage
     * @memberof Locale

     * @description
     *   Lazy loads passed language translations and stores them in the instance property.

trailingComments.value:
*
     * @name translate
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} value String to translate.
     * @param {Array} args - Array of string values that will be used as placeholder `%s` replacements in translation.
     * @returns {String} The translated string.
     * @description
     *   Translate the given string in current language and perform placeholder replacements.
Make sure the value is string.

leadingComments.value: Make sure the value is string.

trailingComments.value: Get translated string or continue with untranslated value for interpolation.

leadingComments.value: Get translated string or continue with untranslated value for interpolation.

trailingComments.value: If array argument wasn't supplied, translation is ready and can be returned.

leadingComments.value: If array argument wasn't supplied, translation is ready and can be returned.

trailingComments.value: Otherwise, we replace all %s with the given arguments from passed array.
Replace only replaces the first occurence, so we have to use it in a loop.

trailingComments.value:
*
     * @name localeConfig
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} key Key to return from the locale configuration.
     * @returns {String} The configuration value, if found.
     * @description
     *   Return value for a locale configuration key. Supported are:
     *   - Charset
     *   - Completeness
     *   - DateFormat
     *   - DateFormatLong
     *   - DateFormatShort
     *   - DateInputFormat
     *   - DateInputFormatLong
     *   - DecimalSeparator
     *   - Separator
     *   - ThousandSeparator
     *   - TextDirection

did not receive this file, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/agpl.txt.

*
    * Constructor. Initializes translations for the passed language argument.

*
     * @name setLanguage
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @returns {Promise}
     * @description
     *   Lazy loads passed language translations and stores them in the instance property.
Assign a special chunk name to identify these very large chunks more easily.
Set document lang attribute to the language ISO 639-1 code.
Set document text direction to value defined in the locale configuration.

*
     * @name translate
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} value String to translate.
     * @param {Array} args - Array of string values that will be used as placeholder `%s` replacements in translation.
     * @returns {String} The translated string.
     * @description
     *   Translate the given string in current language and perform placeholder replacements.
Make sure the value is string.
Get translated string or continue with untranslated value for interpolation.
If array argument wasn't supplied, translation is ready and can be returned.
Otherwise, we replace all %s with the given arguments from passed array.
Replace only replaces the first occurence, so we have to use it in a loop.

*
     * @name localeConfig
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} key Key to return from the locale configuration.
     * @returns {String} The configuration value, if found.
     * @description
     *   Return value for a locale configuration key. Supported are:
     *   - Charset
     *   - Completeness
     *   - DateFormat
     *   - DateFormatLong
     *   - DateFormatShort
     *   - DateInputFormat
     *   - DateInputFormatLong
     *   - DecimalSeparator
     *   - Separator
     *   - ThousandSeparator
     *   - TextDirection

the enclosed file COPYING for license information (AGPL). If you
did not receive this file, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/agpl.txt.

*
    * Constructor. Initializes translations for the passed language argument.

*
     * @name setLanguage
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @returns {Promise}
     * @description
     *   Lazy loads passed language translations and stores them in the instance property.
Assign a special chunk name to identify these very large chunks more easily.
Set document lang attribute to the language ISO 639-1 code.
Set document text direction to value defined in the locale configuration.

*
     * @name translate
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} value String to translate.
     * @param {Array} args - Array of string values that will be used as placeholder `%s` replacements in translation.
     * @returns {String} The translated string.
     * @description
     *   Translate the given string in current language and perform placeholder replacements.
Make sure the value is string.
Get translated string or continue with untranslated value for interpolation.
If array argument wasn't supplied, translation is ready and can be returned.
Otherwise, we replace all %s with the given arguments from passed array.
Replace only replaces the first occurence, so we have to use it in a loop.

*
     * @name localeConfig
     * @memberof Locale
     * @function
     * @param {String} key Key to return from the locale configuration.
     * @returns {String} The configuration value, if found.
     * @description
     *   Return value for a locale configuration key. Supported are:
     *   - Charset
     *   - Completeness
     *   - DateFormat
     *   - DateFormatLong
     *   - DateFormatShort
     *   - DateInputFormat
     *   - DateInputFormatLong
     *   - DecimalSeparator
     *   - Separator
     *   - ThousandSeparator
     *   - TextDirection
